poem:
Title: "The Colours of Kinship"

Dusky greys lie dormant; 
a Shaker prayer in timber.
Azure waves of longing, 
silently they whisper.

Rise, vibrant spectrums called to life,
in the carpenter's caress.
Hub of home sings in pink delight,
a palette bears no less.

Damseaux unveils a canvas bold,
where life stirs, chores done.
In kitchen folds, tales to be told,
under the same warm sun.
